definition: to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Where has religion taken shelter after Krsna has retired to His own abode?
sentences.chinese: 当奎师那离开回到祂自己的居所后宗教到哪里去托庇？

sentences.english: I have given the waste land for a heritage, and the salt land as a living-place.
sentences.chinese: 我使旷野作它的住处，使咸地当它的居所。

sentences.english: He gave Himself for your ransom, gave up His glory above;
sentences.chinese: 离开天上荣耀居所，将自己作你赎价。

sentences.english: Who found favour before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
sentences.chinese: 大卫在神面前蒙恩，祈求为雅各的神豫备居所。

sentences.english: It is similar to paying the household insurance premium to protect you in the event of a fire.
sentences.chinese: 这就跟您替居所购买一份家居火灾保险一样尤其重要。

sentences.english: My children are grown have their own homes and I have grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 我的孩子们的成长的有自置居所，并有孙子女。

sentences.english: Their homes were pillaged and destroyed, their possessions confiscated.
sentences.chinese: 他们的居所被掠夺和摧毁，财产被没收。

sentences.english: The laws at the habitual residence of the adopter at the time of adoption shall apply to the validity of adoption.
sentences.chinese: 收养的效力，适用收养时收养人经常居所地法律。

sentences.english: Bow down, archangels, in your dim abode.
sentences.chinese: 躬身致意吧，大天使，在你幽暗的居所。

sentences.english: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.
sentences.chinese: 我智慧以灵明为居所，又寻得知识和谋略。

sentences.english: Why do you scorn my sacrifice and offering that I prescribed for my dwelling?
sentences.chinese: 我所吩咐献在我居所的祭物，你们为何践踏。

sentences.english: Let us go into his tent; let us give worship at his feet.
sentences.chinese: 我们要进他的居所，在他脚凳前下拜。

sentences.english: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.
sentences.chinese: 我使旷野作它的住处，使咸地当它的居所。

sentences.english: They burned your sanctuary to the ground; they defiled the dwelling place of your Name.
sentences.chinese: 他们用火焚烧你的圣所，亵渎你名的居所，拆毁到地。

sentences.english: The papacy was based at Avignon until 1377, when it returned to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 教皇以阿维尼翁为居所直到1377年回到罗马。

sentences.english: I have built a magnificent temple for you, a place for you to dwell forever.
sentences.chinese: 但我已经建造殿宇作你的居所，为你永远的住处。

definition: to reside/to dwell/to live in a place/resident in
